content:
What a thoughtful gesture! Yes, it's absolutely okay to reach out to George and ask about the outcome of his job interview. In fact, it shows that you're interested in his life and care about his well-being.

Reaching out to George can also help to:

1. **Show genuine interest**: By asking about his job interview, you're demonstrating that you value his time and are interested in his life.
2. **Build a connection**: Following up with George can help to build a stronger connection and potentially lead to a meaningful friendship.
3. **Provide support**: If George didn't get the job, your support and encouragement can go a long way in helping him stay positive and motivated.

When reaching out to George, you could say something like:

"Hi George, I wanted to follow up on our conversation at the grocery store the other day. I hope everything went well with your job interview! I was thinking about you and wanted to see how it turned out. Either way, I'm rooting for you and hope things are going well."

Remember to be genuine, kind, and respectful in your approach. George will appreciate your thoughtfulness, and who knows, it might even lead to another great conversation!
